Key factors customers will use to judge the value of our product

The core value of this project is wrapping other well developed technologies into a single system for the end user. This will allow researchers to provision the storage of data and enter all relevant metadata in a single interface which publishes nationally to Research Data Australia (RDA).

One of our key user groups is researchers that are looking for a way to store their data. These users will be primarily concerned with:

  1. Ease, speed and stability of using the system.
  2. Ability to ingest their particular type of data either via manual upload or directly streamed.
  3. Ability to process their data, how they want it processed, when it is ingested.
  4. Ability to enter all relevant metadata about their research in an appropriate manner.
  5. Appropriate workflow for publishing their data nationally on Research Data Australia (RDA).

The first point requires a well-developed, intuitive user interface that allows researchers to easily setup a project with the associated metadata, processors and reporting as well as providing an easy way to add new data to a currently running project.

The second and third points hinge around the flexibility of ingestors and processors written for the CoastalCOMS Data Access Management (CC-DAM) and the ease of implementing new ingestors. We are gathering information from researchers who use the four data types to find current and foreseeable ingestor requirements.

To address the fourth and fifth points our systems interface will require valid RIF-CS metadata and use James Cook University's (JCU) ReDBox-Mint software to store and publish the metadata.

The other key user group is researchers that are searching for data to use in their own research. These users will be primarily concerned with:

  1. Quality of metadata that the system captures
  2. Ease of searching and accessing data
  3. Quality of reporting and output methods.

The first two points will be addressed by using JCU's ReDBox-Mint system which requires valid RIF-CS metadata and publishes records nationally on RDA.

The third point will be addressed by providing well documented methods of querying the CC-DAM system to suit the requirements that JCU researchers can foresee needing.
